intro: Microstegium lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Microstegium lanceolatum is an important component of forest understory ecosystems.
